website_summaries.verdict: While this can be difficult to set up, once you are up and running, it is a great way share an internet connection and files.
pros: Features speeds of 300Mbps on the 2.4GHz band and 433Mbps on the 5.8GHz band
Includes built-in filehub and support for SD cards
Easily back up files with one-key backup
Supports a variety of devices, including Chromecast and Roku
cons: Setup can be a bit challenging
Some buyers report problems with reading some SD cards

customer_reviews.title: Great little box!! worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the original unit, it was getting very hot. I reached out to vendor/seller and they provided me with a replacement unit. New unit works great!! i used it on a 5 hour flight, using iPad and android with no issues. here is the video showing the old and the new with the temperature problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Android Users BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: So, take it from me as someone who tried this product THREE TIMES. The app for the device makes it useless as a Wireless Access Point. When viewing YouTube vids, you'll find that the device works perfectly on iPads to find Wifi connections and function as a wireless hotspot. What you dont see is how useless the Android app is in finding those wifi spots (secure on unsecure) and makes it so you cant use the device as a wireless access point. Again, it's due to poor development of the app. You have to scan maybe 15 times before you finally find a wireless signal with it. Its strictly the app that makes me return this.
customer_reviews.author: Phenomenon007

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Update, after posting my review about having issue with transfers, the seller reached out and offered a replacement. I have not had an issue with the replacement device. I've been able to copy GB files over to my iphone and ipad for editing. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: J Gandy

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother. Really
customer_reviews.text: Nothing on this unit worked. Couldn't read the SD card. WiFi didn't work. Couldn't transfer data. Basically it was as if I had bought a black box with some holes in it. Think that I got a bum unit? Think again. The thing requires you to download an App from the Google Playstore or Apple Store to do other things. But no such app exists in the Playstore and take a gander at the rating of the RAV hub app in the Apple Store. Still not convinced, go to the RAVPOWER website. This unit isn't even mentioned! Amazon should ban this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Prof J

customer_reviews.title: Swollen Battery/Case!
customer_reviews.text: My unit arrived with a swollen case on the bottom. If I lay it on a flat surface it wobbles. When the unit is powered on, the same area on the bottom is very warm. This is not normal! There are still obvious quality control issues. I own the FileHub WD03 which is smaller and has the same battery capacity as this newly released WD009. I’ve tested transfer rates as well and I don’t see any significant difference. With a modified script found on github my older model WD03 has the same copy function as the this newer unit. Maybe I got a faulty unit, RAVPOWER, are you listening!?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff !
customer_reviews.text: Got this to share with my Apple iPad and to free up some space. Going to be getting a newer iPad and this device will act as a space saver via an external ssd. Also can make use of sd cards and usb flash drives. very nice device......very useful. Hats off to Ravpower!
customer_reviews.author: O.D.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi transfers is awesome 👏
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi feature makes transferring photos so easy and can play video files with the free app. Love it, definitely a much have for the new iPad Pro. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: john k phan

customer_reviews.title: New Firmware updated to SMB2
customer_reviews.text: Removed previous negative review in an attempt to be fair to RAVPower. Although I have not yet had an opportunity to test the new device. I'm updating my previous product review because of their proactive and speed in which they were able to update the firmware and provide me with a new device. A new review will be posted once I've tested the new device.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sville

customer_reviews.title: Fails with hotel captive portals
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this device but it is very limited in how it attaches to a hotel WiFi. It appears if the hotel has a captive portal where you have to sign in or otherwise agree to their terms of service this unit just gives up. The hotel WiFi appeared on my phone asking me to click to login to it. Opened the Rav app, scanned networks, nothing showed up. This may work for some hotels but has serious limitations.
customer_reviews.author: mg858

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to like this. I had high hopes for it, but the model I received only had Chinese characters so I was not able to use. I contacted support and they stated that I might have been shipped one intended for China. They recommend I work through Amazon to return. Sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great device for travelers who film and shoot tons photos
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is really sweet. I bought it to transfer my 4k60/HEVC files for my GoPro to my iPad to edit and it exceeded what I thought it could do. I utilize the SD to USB one button transfer often and the wireless transfer is slow but is stable. On 5G it transfers at about 10mbs. The settings for WiFi and SSID is also pretty extensive by allowing you to change the name and set passwords. It also does not need to be plugged into a wall to turn on as long as the battery is charged. I'd recommend this device for anyone who travels and takes a lot of video or photos and needs to clear their SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Little device
customer_reviews.text: With so many functions, it's amazing how compact this thing is. You really can't do much better than router/card reader/portable battery pack/AP. I found the simplicity of its function a double-edged sword; I liked that there weren't too many ways to get lost, but with only one physical button at makes it difficult to remember how many presses and for how long and which lights will light up indicating the mode it's in. Once you have the accommodating app or visit its web interface, it's not as cumbersome. It's also not very refined, but that's OK because it still functions. All in all, totally worth it if you need a portable routing solution that includes a 5gHz band.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Hidden Gem!
customer_reviews.text: I know this little thing does quite a bunch of things, but I mainly got it for one reason and that's for easily backing up my SD cards to a hard drive without a computer. I've been eyeing the Gnarbox for awhile now, but I couldn't justify paying the ridiculous price for it. The RavPower FileHub basically does the exact same thing for a fraction of the cost. The Gnarbox does come with a built-in SSD drive, but for the cost, you can probably purchase a couple of SSD drives to use with the FileHub.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lu

customer_reviews.title: Great little device!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to help me transfer files to my Ipad Pro. The device itself works great! But don't expect the Ipad to cooperate fully. Apple is still bent on not letting you view or transfer certain files. Raw files are a problem. Not the devices issue. The issue is with Apple. The RAVPower FileHub is easy to use and setup was breeze. Some don't like the file system app that Rav provides but I think it's great! The device is well worth it and can help you wirelessly transfer files to your Ipad Pro or other compatible device. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: MogMan

customer_reviews.title: Handles multiple video streams
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the RAVPower FileHub to act as a media hub for road trips and locations with limited or no cell phone service. I copied the kids movies onto an external 1 TB SSD (Intel 660P in an SSK Aluminum M.2 NVME SSD Enclosure Adapter). All 3 kids have been able to simultaneously stream 720p/1080p movies on their Fire 8 HD tablets. The SD card backup function has been really convenient for backing up my action camera and drone footage to the external drive too. I also like using the mobile app to also backup my photos and video from my mobile phone to free up space.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey S

customer_reviews.title: Well made, useful device, that suffers from inadequate documentation.
customer_reviews.text: I was beside myself with frustration with this device until I viewed some UTube vids that unlocked the secret--something they never tell you in the documentation--how to properly turn it on. One press to activate the battery for charging to charge another device--a LONG PRESS to turn on Wi-Fi (wi-fi light comes on). And yes-no quick start guide and no documentation that so much as mentions this critical fact. Now all is well, but I was very close to sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: maddy

customer_reviews.title: Use as cheaper variation of the Gnarbox
customer_reviews.text: I want the simple backup capability similar to the Gnarbox: copying videos on a SD card to a USB device automatically and this does that. I don't need the advanced functionality of a Gnarbox, so spending $499 for a 256MB version was not worth it since I can literally insert any size USB stick or drive to back up a complete SD card. Though there are other features that may come in handy in the future, I haven't fully explored them yet, but for what I need it to do, it's awesome! I know that I can back up video footage on the fly and not worry if a SD card is lost since I will have a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Handy for extending wifi coverage and travel NAS storage
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome with one drawback. You have to evaluate the external storage device you are connecting to see how much power it consumes before plugging it in. If the drive needs too much power, it will only work for a short period and then it just stops responding. I'd recommend using flash drives and Solid-State External hard drives if you don't know the power consumption. These don't have spinning disks that require a lot more power to operate. Those drives perform faster anyway, so I'd recommend getting one if you don't already have one.
customer_reviews.author: zdrjla;>$

customer_reviews.title: Worked once.
customer_reviews.text: It connected to my external hard drive once and worked great, next morning it couldn't do anything. Couldn't connect to the device to save its life. There is also an app called Rav Power that reviewers blame for lack of device connection, however other filehub apps gave me the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Always have to power cycle to get it working again
customer_reviews.text: 1. This device goes offline all the time on its own. I have to power cycle it to get it working again. 2. Customer Service is a joke. Do not think you will get ahold of them to get help. 3. Network goes down the second internet is lost. Network should stay in tack (without internet) even when it looses internet connection. I should be able to see all my devices that are on the RAVPower Filehub's own network even if the RavePower loses internet.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. So much you can with it. I primarly use it a media server. Just connect my external hard drive full of movies, and broadcast the private wifi network. We connect to it from our phones, ipads, or laptops, and we all have access to the movies stored on, all powered by the internal battery. Great for road trips, or nights at the campsite. Can also be used a wifi router, so when we stay at hotels, I can create my own private wifi network, and not have to rely on the public hotel wifi. Can even use it to charge your phones! This thing does it all!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice solution for image transfer, in my case...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty handy for sharing images from ancient, wireless-less cameras while traveling. The process entails moving an SD card from the camera to the Rav, but from a standing start I can get jpegs to the phone in 60-90 seconds, counting setup, moving the card, and 'boot' time (20~ 30 secs to get the wifi going). While not exactly a "SnapBridge" level of convenience it is workable. The android app isn't awesome, but from it images can be shared directly with LightRoom mobile, enabling fairly quick editing and broadcast to the world or to your mom on Facebook.
customer_reviews.author: Chancy Rendezvous

customer_reviews.title: Great for sd card management away from home
customer_reviews.text: I used this at my son’s sporting events to manage sd card storage. Simple design and good instructions. It was very easy to get the files off the sd card and onto my phone or backup hard drive. I use an older DSLR For the video, but with this can quickly get the videos on my phone to share with my wife, who is usually at another kid’s game, or to the grandparents. If we play multiple games in a day this also helps me keep the sd card memory good with easy transfer to an external hard drive. It also makes all my old hard drives wifi capable. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P Schupp

customer_reviews.title: On paper, it sounds promising, but in real life it doesnt fulfil
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a media hub like the Gnarbox so i can transfer images from my camera to the phone. The manual has so many missing infos that you NEED to google or search instructions on youtube. The companion app that came with it hasnt been updated in so long. Wifi signal is slow, didnt bother to be honest to make it into a bridge. It does serve as a external battery so that's a plus. If you are a serious photographer that shoots raw and travel alot, i recommend you save up and get the Gnarbox or the WD My passport wireless
customer_reviews.author: SiFO

customer_reviews.title: Does not stream movies to Ipad
customer_reviews.text: I read numerous articles on this device. I purchased the Ravpower sdd drive to store files on and use this router in the car as a network to stream movies from the sdd drive. I discovered that it does not work with IOS operating system. If you have tablets then it will work for you but not Ipads. I am returning and buying tablets with a larger amount of built in storage.
customer_reviews.author: Audra

customer_reviews.title: Keep your precious memories safe!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY a way to transfer my priceless photos and video to an external drive WITHOUT a computer! This thing is quick and SUPER handy: use it for transferring photos/vids, to create WiFi at hotel stays by making it a router, and emergency power source... I had an issue with using the device at first, but contacting customer service was painless and actually quite please they (big shout out to them 👍🏻) Would definitely recommend as it might not be used on a daily but which ever function of it your using, its defined worth the money 💵
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: Better than competitors
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly surprised by the quality of this product. I’m a videographer and I use various cinema style cameras, and the video files are usually very large and have a lot of data. I was a little worried that the Filehub would not transfer the files successfully to my hard drive, but it did. It’s pretty seamless to use. The price point for the product is very competitive against other products in the market from companies like DJI and Gnarbox. This product does a lot of the same things as those other products but at a better price point.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Technology In A Small Package
customer_reviews.text: As a young boy watching Star Terk in the 1960's and thinking about the future, the technology in this little box is amazing to me. I can save pictures from my Nikon D 750 in the field to a flash drive or hard drive and view them on my 10 inch Amazon fire, laptop or my phone with the filehub app. My wife likes that she can watch movies or tv shows on her Amazon Fire, that we downloaded to a hard drive, while traveling in the car or motorhome. I have a 10 TB hard drive with all my pictures, documents and movies connected to the filehub that I can access from anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: WV retired

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use. But very usefull
customer_reviews.text: The software that comes whit this device is too old. But works. Its not easy or intuitive the funtions. is hard to change betwen wifi / 5g or Both. If you Santoyo to turn it on its a tap on the power boton, if you Want to to turn on the wifi hold the power buton 4 seconds o something like that. (The wifi start blinking) if u want to change to 5g press the 4g/5g buton for 3 sec while the wifi still blinking. Is not easy to use even if u want to turn it off you need too hold the power buton for 10 seconds. (No, you not only can push the power buton...)
customer_reviews.author: humberto

customer_reviews.title: It's a winner ... for now.
customer_reviews.text: Interface very fast and responsive. Supports USB hard drives greater than 2TB. Also supports exFat file format. Unfortunately RJ-45 interface on supports 10/100 Ethernet speeds. DLNA works perfectly, but I could get not get directories to display over SAMBA on a tablet or smartphone. However, using Windows 10 the directories would display. Battery charging was fast using a 3A charger. Have not tried SD to USB copy feature. Very nice upgrade from RP-WD03.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The reason I purchased the RAVPOWER File Hub was to view photos wirelessly from an SD card and review them on an iPad. It works great for that application. The file hub offers other applications as well, which I have not used, such as backup, transfer of files, travel router, power bank and several others. I received the device fully charged out of the box, ready to use. I emailed customer service with a question and received a very prompt reply; excellent customer support. I would not hesitate to purchase this device again.
customer_reviews.author: Ol Tin Can Sailor

customer_reviews.title: I threw it in the garbage
customer_reviews.text: I rarely throw things out, but after two months of fiddling with this thing in several different networks, I got tired of how it rarely worked. On a normal network, it works briefly, then quits. Requires hard reboot. On captive networks, it works for about 60 minutes, the the cache buffer needs to be reset. On many networks, it will only work after an hour or two of fiddling with it, then work for about an hour, then quit again. The thing is garbage. And that's where I tossed it.
customer_reviews.author: Critic

customer_reviews.title: Updated version of one of the coolest devices I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this updated version of an oldie but goodie, I jumped at it. This now uses USB-C (pretty sure just for charging, not connectivity) and has 5Ghz WiFi (instead of just 2.4). I can't wait to use this during travel. So versatile - I use it for (1) watching movies on a tablet or phone without needing to directly connect to the HDD, (2) taking pics off my camera's SD Card and loading them into Google Photos, and (3) boosting/re-sharing WiFi networks in hotels, etc. Really a great little device.
customer_reviews.author: Krell

customer_reviews.title: new redesigned model shipped Dec 2019
customer_reviews.text: I recently was gifted a 10.5 inch ipad pro and needed a way to access my Lightroom catalogs from the ipad. This has been a great solution! SO far it has worked great! Learning how to use the filehub was a bit of a challenge, but I found a youtube video that explained everything very well: The Technology Man is the name of the channel and the video is titled RAVPower FileHub setup and review (2019 model). Wireless storage for your tablet or smartphone, and dated 4-20-19. If youre struggling as I did to set it up watch that video!
customer_reviews.author: Momma to C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my files and pictures safe And my internet fast
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my files and pictures safe. Irish my purchases because I travel all the time are you do always use the best Wi-Fi whenever I’m out and about at hotels. I also am always taking pictures and wanna make sure they never lose one. This way I can actually download the pictures to the router fast and securely to make sure that it is backed up at all times. Came on time and as ascribed. This is great for travel for daily use has excellent Wi-Fi signal has tech-support so if you ever need some assistance through there to assist excellent value usually a router cost 100+ and this was only half that. Very pleased with the quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Love my deals

customer_reviews.title: Great way to save photos on vacation
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a cruise this past summer. It worked perfectly to save the photos from my GoPro to an external hard drive. Only thing I would caution someone of, is when you backup the SD card using the button, it will create a new folder with the date on it. There was a couple of times where the date had reset after I had turned it off. So, if you want the folders date to be correct, just verify the time is set correctly in the app. This will definitely be going with me on all of my longer trips.
customer_reviews.author: Bobert

customer_reviews.title: RavPower file hub AC750
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and easy unit to use, with excellent english instructions, the best of any I ever bought. Very professional and stylish unit. It is its own wifi to connect your ipad to. This box then connects to your home wifi and acts as a router. The benefit is to play music as if you have your own NAS storage. You could then play all your music files from your iPad, which is bluetooth connected to your stereo BT speaker. If you add a "Visoud" unit also sold on Amazon, you get a very wide Bluetooth connectivity.. The unit operated flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: wizemn1

customer_reviews.title: Works Spectacular for Movies & Photo Backup
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect product. I used it on a long road trip for a week where cell reception is spotty. Loaded a USB drive with movies and kids had endless entertainment. I also used it to back up my photos and GoPro videos while on vacation. Just insert the memory card, press the transfer button and everything is backed up to the USB drive in minutes. I have not used it yet to split a single hotel or plane WiFi connection. One tip, if using a USB drive, use a short, compact one that barely sticks out. I ruined a longer USB drive that got bent while attached in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: CU

customer_reviews.title: Possible Bad Batch of product
customer_reviews.text: Bad batch? I ordered one and charged it overnight. The power light would come on but nothing else would work. I returned the item for a replacement and had the same result. To make sure I wasn't goofing up, I contacted Ravpower tech support (888-456-8468) who recommended returning the item. I am interested in the product but will wait until another version or a working version is available. Given the amount of excellent reviews, this does not appear to be 'normal'. Amazon made the return process easy.
customer_reviews.author: D in WA

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Router
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes Only when is new out of the box , Just PRESS The power Bottom a LITTLE HARD for 4 seconds to turn it On , and the same to turn it Off , This little travel router is perfect for transferring and or watching photos and videos from and to your device , is very fast and the build in battery really helps , im using a 128Gb sd card were you can add and name files to save your photo / videos by your personal category
customer_reviews.author: ParTronic Kmion

customer_reviews.title: Steal of a deal
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is a LOT smaller than I thought! I was expecting it to be around 5"x7" like a small book, but it's 3"x4.5". Wow, impressive. It's heavy too, no doubt that battery. I was not expecting the SD to USB backup with the touch of a single button, that's a serious bonus. I'm just getting more and more surprised here. Deal of the Day had it for a great price, so glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: R. McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Space saver
customer_reviews.text: This unit paid for itself in storage space savings on my Ipad and iPhone It is quick, easy to operate and set up and very fast, no lag time Well built solid case. I was surprised when the flash card would not release but the product is so useful I would have purchased another. Ravpower after a couple of quick emails promptly replaced my unit no charge. I have three of Ravpower ssd drives as well and have every confidence in the company, their products and most importantly great customer service when needed
customer_reviews.author: swineforkbeard

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality and Quality, App Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: This device is really quite good - it small and very functional with outstanding battery life. The manufacturer has corrected an early issue, which may mean they are paying good attention to user feedback. All products could be better - such as this one could benefit from additional card slots being built right in (it has 1 usb and 1 SD card slot) and the App could be more functional (it is very limited on photo viewing capabilities).
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: This is a must in my filming crew
customer_reviews.text: I use this for everything, i use it for my filming business, to transfer files on the Job. Just before my house was done, I've used it for connecting all my smart devices. I am a soul believer in Ravpower devices. Reason i bought this is because i already own the first version of this. I was in love with the first generation. Really good device. The interface can be a little more friendly. But after a while you will get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Re-G Tromp

customer_reviews.title: I regret having bought this RavPower FileHub  Android User Interface Really Sucks, Performance Sucks
customer_reviews.text: This RavPower FileHub really isn't that great, especially if you have used WesternDigital's Wireless Pro drives in the past. They really need to step-up their game when it comes to their Android App - total garbage. I cannot recommend this device as mine now sits on my desk collecting dust because it's just not worth trying to work through the app. It did read my 1TB and 500GB Sandisk Extreme drives just fine but that's as far as the good that I can state.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Turner

customer_reviews.title: Use the new app for this model
customer_reviews.text: Great mobile file share hub just make should you use the new app to copy any thing or SD/flash drive may become corrupted and you will lose you files
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Integration of Needed Utilities
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at how many things this will do and do well. I've been a computer technician for two decades and I can't be without this anymore. When I travel, no more worry about hotel wifi signal (rooms have ethernet cables). Wireless router (ac), power bank, file transfer/storage, network media server. I am amazed!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Turning off and on is hit-or-miss
customer_reviews.text: Loaded with lot of goodies but having below 3 big gripes. returning it back same day I got it: - holding power button on for 5 secs doesn't seem to always power-up filehub - same for powering off. its more miss than a hit to power off - when using its 5G band, I couldn't connect any of my home wireless networks Rav-power team- this really a cool product but please don't complicate basic functionalities like power up/down. will re-consider when you can make button functions more intuitive and full support for 5G frequency bands
customer_reviews.author: Pravin

customer_reviews.title: C R A P
customer_reviews.text: This thing is crap. Even if it can hold data, accessing the data using the weak USELESS buggy grade school app/s is not worth the time or headache. I was really disappointed & felt totally ripped off. Sure I should’ve just returned it instead of keeping it & complaining, but...oh well...live & learn
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: works great on airplanes and hotels
customer_reviews.text: I used this in hotels and airplanes to repeat / bridge / share the wifi signal to multiple devices, it works really nice, the battery lasted for a 16 hour flight and had a little bit left over to keep on going if needed. Having the option to use 5ghz wifi is great, havent tried that feature yet. I got this to replace my HooToo Trip Mate that seems to be NLA.
customer_reviews.author: KevinNJ

customer_reviews.title: Works like a pro!
customer_reviews.text: After realizing my new ipad pro cannot allow you to transfer directly, I was quite distressed. A little googling and I ran across this to alleviate my worries. It needs a charge when you get it. Follow instructions or watch a video on u tube. It took 3 tries to connect for me, but a video warned it might. You download rav filehub app and just light it up once you make sure your device is connected to your bluetooth device.(pad, phone.....) It works very fast with a flashdrive, faster with a hard drive and fastest with a sd card. Works better than you will expect. Super value on line. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended !
customer_reviews.text: I use this product mainly for transferring media from external hard drives to my iPad Pro (of course I can watch media on the HDD without transferring them but then I miss out on some stuff like subtitles files and the player in the filehub software is not that great) and I love the freedom of being wireless and not attached to my laptop waiting for files to finish transferring. They can transfer and I can watch a YouTube video or work on something wires free.
customer_reviews.author: IceCream S.

customer_reviews.title: A must have device!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to back up data from my iphone. I downloaded the filehub app and started to see what the hype was all about. First thing I did was back up my 1500+ phone contacts. This thing processed the data so fast, it finished before I thought it even started! It backs up photos very quickly. I had 3660+ photos done in what felt like a minute. Videos took a little longer. 503 videos took a couple hours. All in all, I wasnt expecting much of it, but I am glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Leep072

customer_reviews.title: A good piece of tech but limited
customer_reviews.text: Good battery size, strong wifi signal, usb port for storage as NAS. This unit has an app to manage and it works ok. However connecting to ethernet and using it as a wifi access point with NAS only works occasionally. It is super fiddly and not as seemless as I hoped. Still a keeper and one I will use.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Harman

customer_reviews.title: Great way to share content locally
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something to steam movies and shows from my hard drive looked through a couple of options before finally giving this a shot. It was relatively easy to use and was able to stream with no noticable lag. Also tested the router capabilities which is pretty cool can connect all my devices to the router so when traveling only need to connect the router to the network great for hotels that only allow a limited amount of devices. Overall pretty happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: unfinished product! Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This product has way too many issues. Password is only simple one, ssid can't be changed/updated, etc. it's useless unsecured device. Most likely it's steal IP product. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Know this Product before you buy it.
customer_reviews.text: On YouTube, seen good reviews and easy friendly device to use. Pro: As Admin User (Ownership) can delete and add pictures and videos very conveniently. Con: As Guest User (Third Party) can delete your pictures and videos from RAVPower FileHub Device as well. For Security purposes, I've contacted Rep. for good advices to protect my personal files. All he can says was I need to go to my computer and activates "Restriction Mode". In which is not a good options. Works ONE way only. Either you or guest have restriction or no restriction. Not much choices as Admin to protect it.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Speed is Achilles Heel
customer_reviews.text: Main use case I bought this for was streaming movies. It cannot stream most 720p -- stutters to the point where they are not watchable. It is nice having access to other files like music, but again, it was the movies streaming I really bought it for. UI does need an update too (and have it rotate with screen please). Otherwise, it is just ok. Seems like the only other option is the Hoo Too -- same company -- and same poor throughput from what I've read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to transfer my photos from my iPhone to an external HDD without a computer and I have found this little gadget and ordered it. I have tested it with SD Cards, USB thumb drive and my 2tb HDD and everything works great. I just gave it 4 stars because it can’t detect my other HDD that is password protected and I wish that a firmware will fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: I recommend the file hub. Replacement unit worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: The initial unit was defective. The seller responded immediately to fix the problem. The first unit wasn't reading both the SD card and USB drives. The replacement unit arrived today. I fully changed it. Powered it up and boom is working as it should.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kontakos

customer_reviews.title: The file hub doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: So luckily I have phone connection with my Carrier because I can't get the file hub to do anything. I am out in the middle of Minnesota by the lakes and the wifi is not the best. I decided to use my adapter to help but the file hub refuses to work. Lucky for me everything else works fine because my cellular connection has a good signal. It's just weird that everything works except the file hub to connect.
customer_reviews.author: J. aikin

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is is Top Notch!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this travel router back in March. I haven't been able to find a single WiFi network to connect my devices to. When I try, the router will sometimes see the SSID, and other times it won't but my laptop will see it. But even when the router will see the SSID, I never can receive a splash page to continue with the authentication. Wasted money on this purchase. 09/18/2019 Update: Customer Service has made things right with a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Most Buys LLC.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little device
customer_reviews.text: This device is so awesome, it really comes in handy and is easy to use. The main reason I got this was to stream movies to my kids tablets while on the road but man it does so much more. We used to carry a hotspot around so the kids could use streaming apps but now we just put movies on a drive, connect it and the kids stream movies from this. My wife loves the fact it has a built in battery so she can charge her phone on the go. I love all the networking features this has and for the price, you cant beat it. I'd definitely recommend this for others.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Adams

customer_reviews.title: What you MUST know to make this unit work
customer_reviews.text: Great product but manual is incomplete (in a serious way). Specifically turning the unit on. Manual doesn't say that to make it work you need to hold the Power button on for 5-10 seconds. Just pushing the button less than 5-10 seconds gives you the illusion that it's on (based on power light) but nothing works. Their Tech Support informed me of this after a detailed list of all my tests. This Power On issue is Critical. Once I knew the secret, EVERYTHING was great!
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: Severe heating problem
customer_reviews.text: While the Ad and brochure say that heating problem has been resolved, the device gets too hot. The heat mounts over time, especially if encased during use - so placing it in pocket or bag while on the go would be risky. A single USB slot makes it impossible to shuffle data across storage devices. I will have to think about returning, and look for a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Draco

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Setup
customer_reviews.text: This router is very easy to setup. I first purchased the TP Link Router and it was not very user friendly at all. I could not figure out how to setup and it seemed like it was designed for the computer tech in mind not for the novice. The RAVPOWER Travel Router works great and is very easy to setup and get started.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Pollack

customer_reviews.title: A “tariff free” bridge between the PC world and Apple iDevives!
customer_reviews.text: It’s portable. It works off battery or USB power plug. File transfer is fast, Data Transfer Rate 5 Ghz or 2.4 GHz! Easy to transfer files from PC to iPhone, iPad and iPro without the need for hardwire connection or internet or iTune. No need to load iTune on your PC. Turns your hard drives into your own personal iCloud without internet connection. Works as a wireless router too! It also can serve as a backup battery. Gives you infinite storage for all Apple Devices without the need for Apple iCloud. Makes life simple for those of us who must use both PCs and Apple iDevices.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Matson

customer_reviews.title: Handy Portable Router
customer_reviews.text: fast speed. long battery life. very handy, especially as a wifi bridge. user interfeace needs a bit of improvement. and useability with other apps, especially music apps that utilize streaming. the contents of the SD card [ in my case hi res audio files] could not be recognized by the music app. if this were addressed, this could have been a better device due to its small size, mobility, fast speed, and a battery life that lasts 12 hours. near perfect travel companion. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ted k

customer_reviews.title: Backups are only data from an SD card.
customer_reviews.text: While this unit may be good as a router, it was not useful for me to backup my Android device. The only backup feature this unit can do is copy an SD card to an external sub storage device, both of which you plug into the Rav device. It then cautions you to make sure your Rav has adequate battery power to complete the backup. It cannot backup any device other than the contents of SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Marv Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device
customer_reviews.text: It does so much in such small package. Perfect for family vacations. I can back up my photos and also let it be the central WiFi router. Hotel WiFi aren’t so great usually so I’m not expecting much but once you’ve set up your devices to this router, from that point you just need to set up one just connection every trip. One minor gripe is the initial setup instruction is bit weak. It’s got manual but I struggled to get this thing connected and set up. Once it’s set up it’s so good.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Hidden treats
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this years ago, I wanted it. I had seen YouTube videos on it. It didn’t let me know what to expect. One key that I realize could happen was having the ability to watch videos on the screen while also having the ability to see other hard drives attached to my iPad Pro with a Lightning cable. This was a very good purchase. And it also has a battery.
customer_reviews.author: William K James

customer_reviews.title: Can't do what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could put my music library on a SD card. Then stream music from the filehub. According to their customer service, it won't do that. I was told you have to transfer the music from the filehub to your device. That defeats what I'm trying to do. I wanted to go camping and keep the phone storage out of the picture and stream music from the filehub. Still looking for a device that will do that.
customer_reviews.author: Willy C

customer_reviews.title: A portable treval wifi router + local file hub but a NAS device
customer_reviews.text: I need a lightweight NAS device so I can setup it home and leave it when travel and use it remotely like wifi security cameras. This device couldn't do those tasks so it doesn't meet my expectation. Besides wifi router functions, I haven't test the rest of the features since I am going to return it. On the first glance, it looks nice and as a wifi router, it works.
customer_reviews.author: X. L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set-up and use.
customer_reviews.text: A simple and easy to set up portable hub which I had seamlessly copying photo files from my IPad to an SD card inserted into the Hub’s card slot, within a few minutes of opening the box. It easily connected to the iPad using the “ Filehub plus” app I downloaded from the App Store. It also connected to the internet through my home WiFi network. It is important to read the user guide to learn the button layout and presses, and also to find the password you need to connect to the HUB. If you do that you’ll find it works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great file hub features
customer_reviews.text: I use it to stream movies on my camper. I log into it with my ipad or computer and hook a 3TB drive into it and it streams nicely to VLC. The battery is a bit weak but I power it from the micro USB port so that's not a problem. The first one I got was wonky and Amazon replaced it with this one which works like a champ. Really like it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Its a great little device. It turns my old external hard drive in to Wireless hard drive, much cheaper than buying new wireless hard drives for sure. Its good for when you travel. Whenever I travel I make sure I bring this device too, it allows the kids to watch their movies in the HD attached to the device and it acts as a router too. Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rami

customer_reviews.title: Innovative product and pretty darn functional
customer_reviews.text: I had the first version of the FileHub due to the limited ability of the IOS products to have attached storage. I travel a lot and this little machine is nice because I can have big storage, get a bit of charge out of it and hook up wireless in places where I only have ethernet. The UI is still a little clunky and they have a ways to go on the setup and security, but overall I'm a fan of this little box.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Greene

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I went to set this router up on my home wifi before taking it into the field, but I was not prepared for the sheer awfulness. It has a terrible amateurish interface, especially when dealing with the network settings. I was never able to connect to my home wifi via the web interface, but, strangely enough, it connected when using the (low-rated) mobile app. Also, when changing the admin password I discovered that it does not allow special characters. Really sorry I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE B SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Way to Upload and Downolad Files
customer_reviews.text: You have to constantly call tech support to figure out why it will not connect to your router even though both are in same network, gets old real quick and I am a tech guy! Tech support has bankers hours 9-5 no weekends. ***Update*** November 12, 2019 Seller contacted me and sent another unit to me, gave not used it yet, found another way to download info from both my phone, iPad, and PC and upload to each device.
customer_reviews.author: Shoot2Thrill

customer_reviews.title: Not the brain dead SD backup I want...
customer_reviews.text: Meh... as an SD backup it’s simply not consistent. Connect the devices, turn it on, press backup button. This has to work 100 out of 100 and it simply does not. Very frustrating...
customer_reviews.author: EEngr

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade to 5GHz
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with our previous RAVpower 2.4GHz Hub and Travel Router, but wanted faster internet speeds in busy hotel neighborhoods where their is a lot of signal interference on the 2.4 band. As soon as I switched to the 5GHz band on the newer router, my speeds went from 28 Mbps to 91 Mbps using the same ethernet cable connection in the hotel room.
customer_reviews.author: N in LA

customer_reviews.title: An On-Time Data-Transfer Solution
customer_reviews.text: ...reminds me of how young-free-spirited, like-minded individuals from High School & College started NETZERO Free-Internet in basements & Apartments & Garages to form the 1st Consumer-oriented Internet Service. Corporations & governments kept barring our ability to transfer & share Our-Data without their prying-eyes, so RAVPower File Transfer is an on-time solution! GBJ
customer_reviews.author: G. Bowman Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Oculus quest extra video storage excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great product so many uses. I mainly bought to stream video to oculus quest which works great. Also been using to transfer photos from my camera to phone. Just pop my micro so in to sd adapter and place in the device and power on. I can carry as many movies on the go as I want on sd cards to watch on my oculus great for the plane. Also can use to cast when playing traveling. Totally worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Msquared22

customer_reviews.title: Super easy solution for camper wifi
customer_reviews.text: I called the company, and they guided me to the right choice. I wanted to use iPad hotspot but watch AppleTV in the camper. So this device easily connects to the hotspot on iPad or iPhone, and allows sharing and streaming to through the AppleTV. As a bonus, it is a battery pack. So I will carry it in my briefcase serving dual purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Booth

customer_reviews.title: Packed with features
customer_reviews.text: This is a small unit but it is packed with features. SD card reader, USB port Wi-fi router, portable charger, this does almost everything for under $50. The reason I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that in an effort to keep the divice small, RAV skimped on the buttons. The power button serves as a multi purpose button and that makes operation of the unit a little clumsy. However I still maintain that this is a good value and I would but it again.
customer_reviews.author: James Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel, very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This product is very great for travel. I’m able to transfer files between devices with this travel router without needing to connect wire successfully. The storage capacity for SD is great because I can use this as an external drive. Also, this device has a power bank that can power without needing to plug in. I’m able to use this as an additional wireless router to connect to my ISP. The signal is very strong and great. I highly recommend this product price is reasonable. The only dislike about this product is if the battery capacity is larger it would be a great power bank travel router
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ho

customer_reviews.title: Have Not Been successful to connect
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to get this set up and connected to my phone for usage for days... the instruction booklet is small!! I could hardly read the text!! Then I couldn’t get this connected. So far it has been frustrating for me. I’ll call tech support next. Hope can finally use this. If not, will be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: feline_graduate_studentTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great idea.
customer_reviews.text: Took it to India with me and used it to connect to the hotel wired internet connection. Then when in the room, had an ipad, iphone and a Google Chromecast 1st gen all connected to it. Since the hotel TV was just Indian channels, I could "cast" YouTube, Netflix from my iphone to the chromecast device via the RavPower. Setup was straightforward and connecting to the hotel network. All good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Small device but very useful
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small device. You can configure and upgrade firmware all from iPad. On your iPad, download new firmware first. The devices built in version is 08 but the latest version is 18 11/30/2019. Turn on device and access 10.10.10.254 to upgrade firmware. Don’t connect to internet while upgrading firmware. The new firmware works better than the old one. You can configure device with old firmware or new one.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The updated model works
customer_reviews.text: ---- Updated Review The seller reached out and had me try the updated model. After an initial test I am pleased to say the SD->USB function works as advertised. Bumping to 5 stars for now and will update after some real-world use. ---- Initial Review Bought it to back up my footage on the road, without needing a computer. Sadly it seemed defective after its initial charge. Even if there are some good units out there, I wonder about longevity. Returned it the next day, and my quest continues...
customer_reviews.author: Otto Hagg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filehub, wifi router and USB charger
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this filehub to use as an emergency file backup device. It also works as a wifi router so I can use multiple devices. Also, it works as a USB charger to charge my phone, etc. I love that it can do so much. The one thing about this is don't lose the instructions as you will need them to access the file website via the PC (There is a app available for your Android or iPhone.) I have had this for a week now and still learning new things that this can do!! This device is really good quality and very durable to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: lorelei b weis

customer_reviews.title: Nonfunctional
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say if this works or not. Mine would power on but then was totally nonfunctional no matter what I tried. I would prefer to give it no stars since I do not know if it did what it was supposed to do. Update: The reviews were so favorable; I ordered a second one. The second one works fine as advertised. In addition, they contacted me several times offering a replacement unit. This is more like it for technical Support. I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: extremely slow read and write speeds (4-12MB/s or ~ 3 - 9 hours for 128GB)
customer_reviews.text: The device is extremely slow at transferring data. should not be used by a professional dump data in the field. It took over 10 hours before I quit trying to backup a nearly full 128gb SDHC uhs ii card to a portable hard drive. Update: Ravpower has reached out to me and offered a full refund. While my review holds true, they get two stars added back for stellar customer service. My review was written outside of the standard return period, and I was not hassled, the refund was processed the same day.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dent

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I have a gen 1 iPad and recently retired my old pc-it was just too slow (old). I have work computers to do heavy lifting but need a “pc” for light home stuff. The iPad connected to the RAV and external 4TB HD works great for file transfers and extra iPad file storage. The iPad, RAV and external/portable USB HD have become my new “pc”! Oh yeah and it arrived a day earlier than Amazon posted when I purchased. Oh yes, don’t forget the RAV works as a backup battery for your tired batteries.
customer_reviews.author: silvatism

customer_reviews.title: Good and does what I needed it to
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, good signal strength, packed full of features and options. is what it says. I gave it four starts because I had problems changing the settings and getting them to stick. It was better using the browser to do it. But the hide ssid slider is useless and never stays on and the 2.5 and 5 signals have two settings pages like they are separate but anything you change on one changes on the other including the name/ssid. still it's good battery powered and very easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.author: Jason Page

customer_reviews.title: very great filehub.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great FileHub and Travel Router. 1. it can be used as a router at home or work place. 2. it can setup a LAN during traveling, driving and working, you can share files, videos, musics with your family anytime. 3. it can extend your laptop, ipad, iphone, and MacBook hard space by connect a 2T SSD. ......
customer_reviews.author: BYUSC

customer_reviews.title: It allows me to connect all my devices and be able to watch my videos without using a hotspot
customer_reviews.text: Love, Love, Love this Ravpower. It makes it very easy to watch your movies and files no matter where you are without connecting to someone else's wifi. I have used it going upstate by car and everyone in the car was able to use either their or tablets to view the movies I saved to my sd card. It is truly one of the best purchases that I have bought this year on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: marvin newman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a unit that would sit between me and the local wifi network, and provide storage and connectivity among the machines and devices I and my roommate own personally, as the wifi here is blocked from internal communication between machines. (bad setup... ugh.) But this does that perfectly. I put my Western Digital 8TB HDD on it, and set up a share for my content connected it to the local wifi, set passwords and SSIDs and bam... it was on and acting as mediator between us and the outside and giving us access to that storage. It's simply a great product that works as advertised and looks good doing it. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Steele

customer_reviews.title: It made backing up over 4000 photos on our cruise simple!
customer_reviews.text: The FileHub worked great! We used it to back up photos each day of an Alaskan cruise from the camera memory card to a portable hard drive. Then we were able to review them on an iPad Pro. We also used to upload a few pictures to a phone to send back to family when we went on-shore. It may not be the fastest transfer, but to backup the card you just start the process and walk away. Just make sure you have the app loaded on all the devices that you want to have access to the filehub before you need them.
customer_reviews.author: D Krnosky

customer_reviews.title: iPad Pro 2018 file transfer solution!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY way to move files and photos from your 2018 3rd generation iPad Pro. Easy to connect using the app, works great for getting photos off of your iPad Pro onto a flash drive or so card or network. Nothing else works. I’ve bought several usb c flash drives to use on the iPad Pro 2018 and they are not recognized. Saw this device on a tech page and it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

product_meta.title: RAVPower FileHub, Travel Router AC750, Wireless SD Card Reader, Connect Portable SSD Hard Drive to iPhone iPad Tablet Smart Phone Laptop for Photo Backup, Data Transfer, Portable NAS, 6700mAh Battery
product_meta.description:
How to use this device?
a. Press power button to turn on battery LED light and charge.
b. Keep press power button turn on WiFi icon light , SD Card LED(only you plug in) light to use one key backup, wireless date transfer, travel router.
c. Use you phone, tablet or laptop to connect the WiFi of this filehub
d. Transfer files via app or web. Shoot picture or video via app and save it to your HDD.
e. Change password to setting admin and guest user. 

Why it can't recognise my portable SSD HDD?
a. Your portable SSD HDD is password protected, we can't recognise it.
b. The wifi chip(WiFi LED light) did not turn on so you can't find the wifi of this device and it also don't detect your SSD HDD.

Supporting to reading USB hard drives up to 3TB and SD/SDHC/SDXC cards up to 256GB.
Perfect for when you need to free up space for Android or iOS devices.
Up to 5 mobile devices can connect simultaneously allowing you to stream media from the SD or USB drives, or you can directly share files between two different storage devices.
As a portable router, you can turn any wired network to wireless, or connect it via a DSL or cable modem.

Please note:
1) Due to the limitation of the Apple iOS system, you can ONLY access the Photos folder on your iPad/iPhone; Filehub is currently unable to sync with media files stored in iTunes to USB storage devices due to digital rights management (DRM).
2) Does not work with Mac formatted hard drive.
3) We have updated micro B Port to USB-C Port in order to charge the filehub better 

What's in the Box
1 x RAVPower Filehub (Model: RP-WD009)
1x USB Cable
1 x User Guide
1 x Lifetime Warranty Card
feature_bullets: [Wireless Data Transfer and Backup Anywhere] Connect SD cards, portable hard drive, SSD wirelessly to your devices (Phone, iPad, iPad Pro, Tablet, Laptop) for not only stream music, photos, videos, browse documents but also transfer files mutually between SD Card, SSD/HDD and your device.(Must hold the power button for 5s until wifi LED light on to turn on filehub)

[AC750 Wireless Travel Router]]Portable Wifi Touter for Travel, Upgraded with 300Mbps Wi-Fi speed on 2.4GHz band and up to 433 Mbps on 5GHz. Instantly convert a wired network to private and share Internet access with multiple Wi-Fi devices via AP Mode/Router Mode/Bridge(Not Support VPN )Note:We have updated micro B Port to USB-C Port in order to charge the filehub better

[One Key Backup] Upload your SD card-stored photos or video to your hard disk or flash drive easily with 12-18 MB/s on Data Transfer Speed without computer. (Must hold the power button for 5s until wifi LED light on to turn on filehub)

[Media Share & Personal Cloud] Seamlessly share with your families, friends and stream your videos, photos, and music on your connected smartphones, tablets, TVs, media players, Chromecast, Roku, and other DLNA devices, via App or Web.(5 device allowed)

[Wireless Free Up Your Devices' Storage] Automatically back up your latest photos and videos to attached SD Card or HDD directly through our RAVPower FileHub via in-app camera. (Please make sure you have connect the wifi of RP-WD009 in 10 metres)

specifications.Wireless Type: 5.8 GHz Radio Frequency, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,663 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
